title._content: Harry Silberstein driving a Paper-Calmenson scrap metal pick-up wagon

tag.raw: Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest
tag.author: 48143042@N05

description._content: Scrap metal salvage was one of the occupations accessible to Jews. For immigrants leaving Europe in the late 1880s, scrap collection was an open field which required minimal capitalization and a willingness to move about. It also allowed the collector to be his own boss and avoid mandatory factory work hours which would have conflicted with Sabbath observance. Paper-Calmenson was founded 1891 and is still in operation. Date: 1900? Source: 17 cm x 13 cm Format: Black and white original photo Subject: Business and industry Coverage: St. Paul; Ramsey Local Identifier: S4#3 Link to our record: http://reflections.mndigital.org/u?/jhs,374 From the Steinfeldt Photography Collection of the Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest.
